title: 5 Ways to Change a File Extension on a Computer

steps.title: Open a file
steps.content: Open a file in its default software program.

steps.title: Click the File menu and then click Save As.
steps.content: Click the File menu and then click Save As. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a location for the file to be saved.
steps.content: Choose a location for the file to be saved.

steps.title: Name the file.
steps.content: Name the file.

steps.title: In the Save As dialog box, look for a dropdown menu labeled Save As Type or Format.
steps.content: In the Save As dialog box, look for a dropdown menu labeled Save As Type or Format.

steps.title: Choose a new file type for the file from the dropdown menu.
steps.content: Choose a new file type for the file from the dropdown menu.

steps.title: Click the "Save As" button.
steps.content: Click the "Save As" button. The original file will still be open in the software program. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Find the new file where you chose to save it.
steps.content: Find the new file where you chose to save it.

steps.title: Right-click the file.
steps.content: Right-click the file. Make sure you're right-clicking the original file rather than the shortcut. On Mac, you'll need to control-click.

steps.title: Click Rename.
steps.content: Click Rename . This is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Erase the current extension.
steps.content: Erase the current extension. For example, in file.txt , you'll erase the .txt part.

steps.title: Type the new extension.
steps.content: Type the new extension. If you want the file to convert into a Word file, you'll type .doc or .docx .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return . This will save the new extension name.

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. Click the Start menu, and then click Control Panel . If you're using Windows 8 , click here .

steps.title: Click Appearance and Personalization.
steps.content: Click Appearance and Personalization. You can find this in the Control Panel. [3] X Research source On Windows 8, in the ribbon, click Options.

steps.title: Click Folder Options.
steps.content: Click Folder Options. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "View" tab, in the Folder Options dialog box.
steps.content: Click the "View" tab, in the Folder Options dialog box. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Make file extensions visible.
steps.content: Make file extensions visible. In the Advanced settings list, scroll down until you see Hide extensions for known file types. Click the box to uncheck it. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click on Apply, and then click OK.
steps.content: Click on Apply , and then click OK .

steps.title: Open the Windows Explorer file browser to see the file extensions.
steps.content: Open the Windows Explorer file browser to see the file extensions.

steps.title: Select a Finder window or open a new Finder window.
steps.content: Select a Finder window or open a new Finder window. You can also click the Desktop to switch to the Finder. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Finder, and then click Settings.
steps.content: Click Finder , and then click Settings . This is in the top toolbar.

steps.title: Click Advanced in the Finder Preferences window.
steps.content: Click Advanced in the Finder Preferences window.

steps.title: Click the "Show all filename extensions" box to add a check.
steps.content: Click the "Show all filename extensions" box to add a check. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Close the Finder Preferences window.
steps.content: Close the Finder Preferences window.

steps.title: Open a new Finder window.
steps.content: Open a new Finder window. The files will now show their file extensions.

steps.title: Open Windows File Explorer.
steps.content: Open Windows File Explorer. [9] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the View tab.
steps.content: Click the View tab. [10] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Check the File name extensions box in the View/Hide section.
steps.content: Check the File name extensions box in the View/Hide section. [11] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Observe the location of file extensions.
steps.content: Observe the location of file extensions. When you open a new Windows Explorer window, file extensions are visible.
